title: Haggai Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Haggai with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 2 chapters.

questions.question: In which year of King Darius's reign did the word of the LORD come to Haggai the prophet?
questions.explanation: The prophecy came in the second year of Darius, as stated in Haggai 1:1.

questions.question: Who was the governor of Judah to whom Haggai delivered the LORD's message?
questions.explanation: Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel was governor of Judah mentioned throughout Haggai 1.

questions.question: What is the occupation or role of Joshua, son of Josedech, mentioned in chapter 1?
questions.explanation: Joshua son of Josedech was the high priest at the time of Haggai's prophecy.

questions.question: According to Haggai 1, what excuse did the people give for not rebuilding the LORD's house?
questions.explanation: The people said, 'The time is not come, the time that the LORD'S house should be built.'

questions.question: What did the LORD tell the people to consider in Haggai 1?
questions.explanation: The LORD repeatedly instructed the people to 'Consider your ways.'

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the economic condition of the people as described in Haggai 1?
options: They sowed much but brought in little
questions.correctAnswer: They sowed much but brought in little
questions.explanation: The people sowed much but brought in little, indicating poor economic conditions.

questions.question: What reason did the LORD give for the people's misfortune in Haggai 1?
options: Because the house of the LORD lies waste
questions.correctAnswer: Because the house of the LORD lies waste
questions.explanation: The LORD said their misfortune was due to the temple being in ruins.

questions.question: What natural phenomenon stopped as a judgment on the people in Haggai 1?
questions.explanation: The heavens were withheld from dew, and the earth from its fruit.

questions.question: Who obeyed the voice of the LORD and the words of Haggai the prophet?
options: Zerubbabel, Joshua, and the remnant of the people
questions.correctAnswer: Zerubbabel, Joshua, and the remnant of the people
questions.explanation: All three groups obeyed as commanded in Haggai 1:12.

questions.question: What did Haggai declare to the people after they obeyed God’s word?
options: I am with you, saith the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: I am with you, saith the LORD
questions.explanation: Haggai encouraged the people with the promise of God's presence.

questions.question: Whose spirits did the LORD stir up to encourage rebuilding the temple?
options: Zerubbabel, Joshua, and the remnant of the people
questions.correctAnswer: Zerubbabel, Joshua, and the remnant of the people
questions.explanation: God stirred up the spirit of these leaders and the people to work.

questions.question: On what day of which month did the people begin to work on the house of the LORD?
options: First day of the sixth month
Twenty-fourth day of the sixth month
Twenty-first day of the seventh month
Twenty-fourth day of the ninth month
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-fourth day of the sixth month
questions.explanation: The work started on the 24th day of the sixth month in the second year of Darius.

questions.question: In Haggai 2, what question does the LORD ask about the temple's former glory?
options: Who is left among you that saw this house in her first glory?
How long will it take to rebuild?
questions.correctAnswer: Who is left among you that saw this house in her first glory?
questions.explanation: The LORD asked who among them had seen the temple's former glory to compare it to now.

questions.question: What encouragement does the LORD give Zerubbabel, Joshua, and the people in Haggai 2:4?
options: Be strong and work; for I am with you
Stop building until the king permits
Build only when you have wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and work; for I am with you
questions.explanation: God commands them to be strong and work, assuring His presence.

questions.question: According to Haggai 2, what will be greater than the former glory of the temple?
options: The glory of this latter house
The glory of the temple in Egypt
The glory of the new king
questions.correctAnswer: The glory of this latter house
questions.explanation: God promises the latter house’s glory will surpass the former.

questions.question: What does the LORD claim ownership of in Haggai 2?
questions.explanation: The LORD declares that silver and gold belong to Him.

questions.question: What question did Haggai ask the priests about holy flesh touching common food?
questions.explanation: Haggai asked if touching with holy flesh would sanctify other foods.

questions.question: How did the priests answer when asked if touching holy flesh made other foods holy?
questions.explanation: The priests answered that touching holy flesh does not make other foods holy.

questions.question: What did Haggai say about the people and their work before the LORD in Haggai 2:14?
questions.explanation: Haggai said the people and their work were unclean before the LORD.

questions.question: From which day did the LORD instruct the people to consider their ways and blessings?
options: From the day they left Egypt
From the day the foundation of the temple was laid
From the first day of the year
From the day of the exile
questions.correctAnswer: From the day the foundation of the temple was laid
questions.explanation: The LORD told them to consider from the day the foundation of the temple was laid.

questions.question: What did the LORD promise would happen to the heavens, earth, sea, and dry land in the future?
questions.explanation: God promised to shake the heavens, earth, sea, and dry land once more.

questions.question: What will come as the 'desire of all nations' according to Haggai 2:7?
questions.explanation: The desire of all nations will come and God will fill the house with glory.

questions.question: What kind of judgment did the LORD say He had sent upon their labor in Haggai 2?
questions.explanation: God smote them with blasting, mildew, and hail in all their labors.

questions.question: Who will the LORD make 'as a signet' according to Haggai 2:23?
questions.explanation: God said He would make Zerubbabel as a signet, showing His chosen status.

questions.question: What did the LORD say He would overthrow in Haggai 2:22?
options: The throne of kingdoms and the strength of heathen kingdoms
questions.correctAnswer: The throne of kingdoms and the strength of heathen kingdoms
questions.explanation: God promised to overthrow the kingdoms and their strength.

questions.question: What did the LORD say about the seed, vine, fig tree, pomegranate, and olive tree in Haggai 2:19?
options: They had not yet brought forth
questions.correctAnswer: They had not yet brought forth
questions.explanation: God noted that as of that day, these plants had not yet borne fruit, but He would bless them.

questions.question: True or False: The people were encouraged to build the house of the LORD because God would be glorified in it.
questions.explanation: God said He would take pleasure and be glorified in the rebuilt house.

questions.question: True or False: Haggai instructed the people to wait until they were wealthy before rebuilding the temple.
questions.explanation: Haggai urged them to be strong and work, not to delay for wealth.

questions.question: True or False: The priests answered that touching unclean things would make other things unclean.
questions.explanation: The priests confirmed that touching unclean things would make other things unclean.

questions.question: True or False: The people’s offerings were accepted by the LORD because they were pure.
questions.explanation: Haggai said their offerings were unclean before the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD promised peace in the place of the temple.
questions.explanation: God promised to give peace in the place of the temple.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD's spirit did not remain among the people according to Haggai 2.
questions.explanation: God's spirit remained among them, and they were told not to fear.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD told the people to consider their ways starting before the foundation of the temple was laid.
questions.explanation: The LORD instructed to consider from the day the foundation was laid and upward.

questions.question: True or False: The prophecy in Haggai was given on the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month in the second year of Darius.
questions.explanation: The word of the LORD came on that exact date as recorded.

questions.question: True or False: Zerubbabel was called the son of Josedech in the book of Haggai.
questions.explanation: Zerubbabel was son of Shealtiel; Joshua was son of Josedech.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD said He would take Zerubbabel as a signet because He had chosen him.
questions.explanation: God declared He chose Zerubbabel and would make him a signet.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Go up to the mountain, and bring _____, and build the house; and I will take pleasure in it.'
questions.explanation: The LORD commands to bring wood from the mountain to build the house.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'I smote you with blasting and with _____ and with hail in all the labours of your hands.'
questions.explanation: God mentions blasting, mildew, and hail as judgments on their labor.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The silver is mine, and the _____ is mine, saith the LORD of hosts.'
questions.explanation: The LORD declares ownership of silver and gold.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'In that day, saith the LORD of hosts, will I take thee, O _____, my servant.'
questions.explanation: God says He will take Zerubbabel as His servant.

questions.question: What was the people's reaction after hearing the word of the LORD through Haggai in chapter 1?
options: They feared before the LORD and obeyed
questions.correctAnswer: They feared before the LORD and obeyed
questions.explanation: The people feared the LORD and obeyed His words through Haggai.

questions.question: What specific work did the LORD command the people to do in Haggai 1:8?
options: Build the house of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Build the house of the LORD
questions.explanation: God commanded them to build the LORD's house.

questions.question: How did the LORD describe the wages the people earned in Haggai 1?
options: Put into a bag with holes
questions.correctAnswer: Put into a bag with holes
questions.explanation: Their wages were wasted as if put into a bag with holes.

questions.question: What is the main theme of the book of Haggai?
questions.explanation: Haggai focuses on urging the people to rebuild the LORD's temple.

questions.question: What does the promise to fill the temple with glory in Haggai 2 symbolize?
questions.explanation: Filling the temple with glory symbolizes God's presence and favor.
